result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke D Harmon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Luke D Harmon
Current: 1921 6th Street South, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2017)
Prior: 2831 Chestnut Drive, Apt 9, Plover, WI 54467 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Luke D Harmon
Current: 2831 Chestnut Drive, Apt 9, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 06-05-2017)
Prior: 526 4th St S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

Defendant Luke D Harmon in court with attorney William George Weiland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CT329, 16CM44, 16CM45 and 16CM90.

8:48 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT329:
Count 1 - No contest

16CM44:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest

16CM45:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 

16CM90:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 in 15CT329, Count 2 in 16CM44 and Count 2 in 16CM45.  Count 1 in 16CM44 is DRI, Count 1 in 16CM45 is DRI and Count 1 & 2 in 16CM90 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CT329:
Count 1 -
Impose 45 day jail sentence to run concurrent to 16CM44 and 16CM45
Jail to commence within 60 days
Report today for start date
Huber priveleges for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
Entire sentence to be served on electronic monitor if approved by risk assessment
Pay $50 fine plus costs/surcharges (DNA)
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
Provide DNA Sample
Zero days suspension
**Jail time to be served in Wood County 

16CM44:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 -
Impose 30 day jail sentence to run concurrent to 15CT329
Jail to commence within 60 days
Report today for start date
Huber priveleges for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
Entire sentence to be served on electronic monitor if approved by risk assessment
Pay $50 fine plus costs/surcharges (DNA)
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
Zero days suspension
**Jail time to be served in Wood County 

16CM45:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 -
Impose 45 day jail sentence to run concurrent to 16CM44 and 15CT329
Jail to commence within 60 days
Report today for start date
Huber priveleges for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
Entire sentence to be served on electronic monitor if approved by risk assessment
Pay $50 fine plus costs/surcharges (DNA)
Zero days suspension
**Jail time to be served in Wood County 

16CM90:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Plea hearing on July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Luke D Harmon in court with attorney William George Weiland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM44, 16CM45 and 16CM90.

2:00 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

Cash bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luke D Harmon not in court, defendant in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM44, 16CM45, 16CM90 and 15CT329.

1:18 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Court questions the defendant if he has an attorney; defendant indicates that he spoke with the Public Defender's Office today.
Defendant may be eligible for a public defender.
Court questions the defendant as to why he missed his court hearings.
Defendant provides his current address.
Defendant has an interview with Esser Glass on Monday; currently babysitting his niece/nephew.
Atty Cousins makes statements regarding notices being mailed.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.

State recommends a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Defendant indicates that he could come up with $200 cash bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Luke D Harmon not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:04 p.m. Court calls case.
Court questions if State has obtained service.
Atty Knaapen does not have an affidavit of mailing


BY THE COURT:
